{{disambig-two|the Golden Tree of [[Valinor]]|[[mellyrn]] planted by [[Samwise Gamgee]]|[[Golden Tree]]}} {{object infobox | name=Laurelin | image = Ralph Damiani - Laurelin.jpg | caption="Laurelin" by Ralph Damiani | pronun={{respell|low|re-lin}} | othernames=''Tulukhedelgorūs'' ([[Valarin|V]])
''Culúrien'' ([[Quenya|Q]])
''Galadlóriel'' ([[Sindarin|S]])
See [[Laurelin#Other names|Other names]] | location=[[Ezellohar]] | owner= | type=Tree/source of light | appearance=Gold-trimmed leaves | creator=[[Yavanna]] | created=V.Y. 3450–3500 | createdlocation= | destroyer=[[Morgoth|Melkor]] and [[Ungoliant]] | destroyed={{YT|1495}} | destroyedlocation= | notablefor= }} '''Laurelin''' was the '''Golden Tree''' of [[Aman]], the female mate of [[Telperion]], and the younger of the [[Two Trees of Valinor]]. Laurelin had gold-trimmed leaves and her dew was collected by [[Varda]] in [[Wells of Varda|her Wells]]. ==History== Laurelin was created by the [[Valar|Valier]] [[Yavanna]] and [[Nienna]] on the hill of [[Ezellohar]], where the Tree shed her light on the realm of [[Valinor]] in the long years before the making of the [[Sun]] and [[Moon]]. Laurelin, the younger of the Two Trees, flowered second after [[Telperion]], and bloomed during the latter part of each Valian day.{{S|1}} [[File:Álvaro Fernández González - The Twilight of Laurelin.jpg|thumb|left|"The Twilight of Laurelin" by [[:Category:Images by Álvaro Fernández González|Álvaro Fernández González]]]] Laurelin was destroyed by [[Morgoth|Melkor]], who used the giant spider spirit [[Ungoliant]] to his evil purpose during the theft of the [[Silmarils]], which caused the [[Darkening of Valinor]].{{S|8}} However, through the power of Nienna and Yavanna, Laurelin produced a single fiery fruit before she died. This golden fire was set in a vessel made by [[Aulë]] and his people, and was steered through [[Ilmen]] by the [[Maiar|Maia]] [[Arien]], making the [[Sun]].{{S|11}} In the [[First Age]], [[Turgon]] made images of the Two Trees that stood in his court of [[Gondolin]], and the one made in memory of Laurelin was called [[Glingal]].{{S|15}} ==Etymology== ''Laurelin'' is said to mean "Song of Gold". The name ''Laurelin'' appears to be [[Quenya]] and contains ''[[laurë]]'' ("gold") and ''[[lind]]ë'' ("song").{{LR|Etymologies}}, pp. 358, 368 ==Other names== '''''Culúrien''''', likely containing the [[Quenya]] elements ''[[KUL|cul-]]'' ("golden-red"){{S|Appendix}}, entry ''cul-'' and ''riende'' ("garland").{{Cite web|articleurl=https://eldamo.org/content/words/word-2409511645.html?neo|articlename=Culúrien|author=Paul Strack|accessed=27 Nov 2024}} Robert Ireland suggests it might rather contain ''úr'' ("fire, heat"), while the suffix is uncertain.{{webcite|articleurl=http://www.quicksilver899.com/Tolkien/SILM/SILM_CE.html|articlename=Silmarillion Dictionary C-E|author=Robert Ireland|website=[http://www.quicksilver899.com/Tolkien/Tolkien_Dictionary.html A Tolkien Dictionary]|accessed=20 August 2020}} '''''Malinalda''''' ("Tree of Gold"),{{S|Index}} composed of the words ''malina'' ("yellow, of golden colour") + ''[[alda]]'' ("tree").{{S|Appendix}}, entries ''alda'', ''[[mal-]]''{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=http://eldamo.org/content/words/word-3600949199.html|articlename=Q. ''Malinalda'' pn.|website=Eldamo|accessed=30 June 2020}} In [[The Later Quenta Silmarillion|The Later ''Quenta Silmarillion'']] manuscript, the Sindarin name of Laurelin is '''''Galadlóriel'''''. In a footnote to the same page three other Sindarin names of Laurelin are given: '''''Glewellin''''' ("song of gold", the same as Laurelin), '''''Lasgalen''''' ("green of leaf"Cf. also ''[[Eryn Lasgalen]]'', "Wood of Greenleaves".), '''''Melthinorn''''' ("tree of gold").{{MR|P3I2}}, p. 155 The [[Valarin]] name of Laurelin was '''''Tulukhedelgorūs'''''.{{WJ|AD1}}, p. 401 ==Other versions of the legendarium== {{expansion}} [[Vána]] named the tree '''''Lindeloksë''''' ("singing cluster").{{LT1|III}}, p. 72 Among the early names of Laurelin was ''Glingal'' ([[Noldorin]], emmended from ''Glingol''), which was later used for the [[Glingal|golden tree of Gondolin]].{{LB|1d}}, pp. 80-81 ==Inspiration== On a note referred to Laurelin's ''spilth'', [[Tolkien]] explains it is meant to indicate that the tree is founded on the [[:Wikipedia:Laburnum|laburnum]] as described by [[Francis Thompson]] in a poem:{{MR|P3I2}}, p. 157-158 {{blockquote|Mark yonder, how the long laburnum drips
its jocund spilth of fire, its honey of wild flame!|''[http://www.gutenberg.org/files/1731/1731-h/1731-h.htm Sister Songs]'', "The Proem"}} {{references}} [[Category:Quenya names]] [[Category:Trees]] [[Category:Valinor]] [[de:Laurelin]] [[fr:encyclo/biologie/flore/laurelin]] [[fi:Laurelin]]
